Question: The work recounts this person's memories and new experiences after a 22-year absence from the Mississippi.
Hints: To further aid Coolbrith, George Wharton James visited this person in New York and arranged for a new portrait session.
In 1847, when this person was 11, his father died of pneumonia.
Initially resistant, this person admitted that four of the resulting images were the finest ones ever taken of him.
